page.title: 03THE PIER HERNE BAY (part 2)
page.content: unsafe and during violent storms in 1978 parts of the pier collapsed. Rebuilding costs were so high that the pier seaward of the pavilion was demolished and only the cafe was left as an island, taken over by the seagulls. In 1985 the future of this cafe is undecided. There are two councillors who are governors of Hampton School one of whom thinks that the building should have been dismantled and possibly re-erected on the shore, while the other feels that if it were dismantled it would just rot in a council yard. Perhaps a proposed scheme to take tourists to the cafe by boat will be tried but in 1985 the building stands as a reminder of the length of the World's second longest pier.
